page.title: 14TOURISM IN CONGRESBURY
page.content: Cadbury Hill,just outside Congresbury, has the remains of an Iron Age fort and a Roman Hill fort.Many ancient coins and artifacts have been found in and around the village.There are beautifull views of the Wrington Vale and surrounding countryside from Cadbury Hill. In the centre of Congresbury is the village cross,this was the old market cross and meeting place. The Cheddar Valley Railway line,the old strawberry line,ran through the village.It was closed in 1963,it is now a footpath and you can walk all the way to Cheddar. You can walk along the banks of the River Yeo.There is an annual Tug of War contest across the Yeo the loosers are pulled into the river.The Yeo has flooded several times-last time in 1968.
